page.title: 01General Outline of Area
page.content: General Outline Edlingham Area This area is almost entirely rural, consisting of farmland which is largely devoted to sheep farming and just a few herds of cattle, none of which is used for dairy purposes. The only crops grown are barley for local consumption as cattle food and a little wheat. There is a small brick-works which is the areas only bit of industry. The only village is Edlingham, which might be more correctly described as a hamlet, consisting of 15 houses with no shop, post office or public house; the only amenities being a telephone box and a pillar box. The total population is about 90 which is increased slightly when two or three holiday cottages are occupied and when the camp-site nearby is busy in the summer months.
